comprehensive_overview: SPAdes Overlap-Layout-Consensus (SPOA) is a C++ library and command-line tool for sequence alignment using a partial order graph (POG). It provides an efficient way to align long error-prone reads (such as Nanopore or PacBio) by constructing a graph based on input sequences and then finding the optimal alignment through a dynamic programming algorithm.
core_features: Sequence alignment using partial order graph (POG)
Efficient alignment of long error-prone reads
Dynamic programming algorithm for optimal alignment
